Course material for Dr. Johnson's *Statistical Methods* (Stat 251, Section 01) at the University of Idaho for the fall semester of 2021.

```{r, message = FALSE, echo = FALSE, fig.width = 9, fig.height = 7, fig.align = "center"}
set.seed(124)

library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)

crawl <- faraway::crawl %>% mutate(month = 1:n()) %>% uncount(n) %>% 
   group_by(month) %>% mutate(age = rnorm(n(), crawling, SD)) %>%
   mutate(age = SD * (age - mean(age))/sd(age) + crawling) %>% 
   select(age, month) %>%
   mutate(month = factor(month, levels = 1:12, labels = rownames(faraway::crawl))) %>%
   mutate(meanage = mean(age))

p <- ggplot(crawl, aes(x = month, y = age)) + theme_minimal() + 
   geom_dotplot(binaxis = "y", method = "histodot", binpositions = "all", binwidth = 0.5) + 
   labs(x = "Birth Month", y = "Crawling Age (weeks)", title = "Crawling Age by Birth Month",
        caption = "Note: Crawling age is the reported age (in weeks) when the child can first crawl four feet in a minute or less.") +
   coord_flip() + theme(plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) + 
   geom_point(aes(x = as.numeric(month) - 0.2, y = meanage), shape = 17, size = 2, color = "red")

plot(p)
```
